title: Documentation about `RecordCodecProvider` in MongoDB with Panache

labels.name: area/housekeeping
labels.description: Issue type for generalized tasks not related to bugs or enhancements

body:
### Description

The documentation about MongoDB with Panache says that Quarkus uses the `PojoCodecProvider` to serialize documents. That is not exactly correct because using the repository pattern, Quarkus can also use the `RecordCodecProvider` to serialize records.

See [integration-tests/mongodb-panache/src/main/java/io/quarkus/it/mongodb/panache/record](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/tree/ba974830d96fac4622e5a619b0c82afe9b60b8d3/integration-tests/mongodb-panache/src/main/java/io/quarkus/it/mongodb/panache/record) for an example how to use records with MongoDB and Panache.

### Implementation ideas

The documentation should be updated to inform developers about the possibility of using records. One could also mention that a regular class may have a record as an attribute or vice versa and can still be serialized. Especially this line should be changed:

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/ba974830d96fac4622e5a619b0c82afe9b60b8d3/docs/src/main/asciidoc/mongodb-panache.adoc?plain=1#L325
